tool.name: Phylotype
tool.description: Assign sequences to OTUs based on taxonomy
tool.command: mothur_wrapper.py --cmd='phylotype' --result='^mothur.\S+\.logfile$:'$logfile,'^\S+\.sabund$:'$sabund,'^\S+\.rabund$:'$rabund,'^\S+\.list$:'$otulist --outputdir='$logfile.extra_files_path' --taxonomy="$taxonomy" #if 50 >= int($cutoff.__str__) > 0: --cutoff="$cutoff" #end if #if $name.__str__ != "None" and len($name.__str__) > 0: --name='$name' #end if #if $label.__str__ != "None" and len($label.__str__) > 0: --label='$label' #end if

param.name: name
param.label: name - Names reference file for the taxonomy

param.name: label
param.label: label - Taxonomy Levels to report (All when none are selected)

param.name: cutoff
param.label: cutoff - Truncate the taxonomy at depth (Ignored if < 0)

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documenation**
The phylotype_ command assign sequences to OTUs based on their taxonomy and outputs a a list_, a sabund_ (Species Abundance), and a rabund_ (Relative Abundance) file.
.. _list: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/List_file .. _rabund: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Rabund_file .. _sabund: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Sabund_file .. _phylotype: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Phylotype
